title: Where can I find good examples of native Modern Greek handwriting in order to develop my own? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Communicate in Greek” textbook 1 (επικοινονήστε ελληνικά) has some decent handwriting exercises, which you can photocopy so you don’t have to write in the book. And the workbooks that go with the textbooks are full of great writing exercises. It goes over the basic, generic forms of the letters (with some variations) and shows you how to trace them. But it doesn’t come close to covering ALL of the dizzying variety of cursive letters you’re likely to encounter. It’s good for beginners, but the handwriting examples they give are pretty artless and boring. I wish there were a better resource available; at least I wish I had had such a resource when I first started learning Greek. Maybe someone on Quora can suggest one. Here are a few online references:   Eleni Loves the Handwriting of Greek Notaries (polytonic script)

Here are handwriting samples from three famous Greeks of the arts and literature. Cavafy, Kontoglou and Papadiamantis  the poet Constantine Cavafy  the painter and author Photis Kontoglou, who wrote in a sort of Byzantine script  the author Alexandros Papadiamantis
